other_tests.findings: The liver is normal in shape and contour with normal echogenicity. No focal hepatic lesions. The main portal vein is patent with normal hepatopetal flow. No intra- or extra-hepatic biliary duct dilation. The common bile duct measures 4 mm. The gallbladder is mildly distended with sludge, no evidence of stones, and shows gallbladder wall thickening and edema, more marked than in the prior exam. A positive sonographic sign was noted.
other_tests.changes_over_time: There is gallbladder wall thickening and wall edema, more marked than in the prior exam.
